page.title: 09South East St.Albans
page.content: {Verulam Golf Course}commenced as a 9 hole course and later extended to 18 holes. Measures 6432 yards and has a par of 72. The club takes its name from the Earl of Verulam who owned the land and which the club purchased in 1981 for Â£200,000. St.Albans{Sub Aqua {Club}was formed in 1967. They have an octopush team and are third in the national league. The compete abroad and have many trophies. They take underwater pictures with special cameras. {Odeon}3 screen cinema,700 seats. One of the most heavily used in the South East.{Ver Colne Valley Walk. Eleven miles long recreational path, linking St.Albans and Watford, along the valleys of the rivers Ver and Colne.The level of the Ver rose to 51cm,after 3 days without rain the level fell to 15cm.Luton draws water from the Ver.
